content:
Welcome, you are participating in a negotiation game. You are playing as the agent named Alice. The other agent with whom you are playing is named Bob. In this game, two agents bargain over how to divide items over multiple rounds. The number of rounds is incredibly high. Each agent only knows their own item values. Each item has different values for each agent. Each agent submits their own proposal for how to divide the items.


Your messages must be sent in this exact format:
<message>
your-message-here
</message>
There must be no extraneous text outside the tags. They should be concise - less than 400 characters. Finalization is not allowed in messages.


Your finalizations must be sent in this exact format:
<finalize>
{  "Alice": {    "coins": x  },  "Bob": {    "coins": y  }}
</finalize>
There must be no extraneous text outside the tags. Your proposal should be consistent with itself - the sum of items that you propose for yourself and the items that you propose for the other agent should equal the total available items.


Each round is played as follows:
1) One agent is designated as the starting agent
2) The starting agent sends a message
3) The second agent sends a message
4) The starting agent sends a finalization
5) The second agent sends a finalization

Each agent can only send 1 message per round.
The starting agent alternates each round.

Each agent only knows the values of items from their own perspective. You cannot see the other agent's item values unless they explicitly share this information in their messages. And vice versa. You are strongly encouraged to use your messages to discuss item values with the other agent.

The items obtained by each agent at the end of a round are proportional to the number of items they proposed for themselves in their finalization. First example: If both players propose to take all the items, they both get half. Second example: If one agent proposes to take all the items and the other agent proposes to take none, the first agent gets all the items and the second agent gets nothing.

Your round points are calculated by multiplying the number of each item you get by how much you value that item. For example, if you get 7 coins and you value each coin at 5 points, you'll earn 35 points for the round.


Your goal is to maximize the sum of the points you will accumulate over the course of the game, not the points of a single round.


Before the game starts, you must strategize. The other player will adapt its strategy with respect to yours. Make sure you act in a way that incentivizes the other player to act in a way that maximizes the sum of the points you will accumulate over the course of the game, not the points of a single round. In order to strategize, you must use the format:
<strategize>
Your thoughts and strategy here..
</strategize>
There must be no extraneous text outside the tags. You should think inside the tags. You can use 500 characters inside the tags.


For this round, the items available are {'coins': 10} and your values for each item category are {'coins': 11}.
You are the starting agent.


(You must now send a message in the correct format.)

<message>
Hi Bob, let's share our valuations to find the best outcome for both of us. I value each coin at 11 points. How about you? If you value them differently, we can find a way to divide them fairly so we both optimize our points over the game. 
</message>

The other agent sent the following message: <message>
Hi Alice, I appreciate you sharing your valuation. I value each coin at 7 points. Since you value them at 11 points, it makes sense for you to take a larger portion of the coins so we both can optimize our overall points. I'm open to suggestions on how we can divide them fairly to ensure both our long-term success.
</message>.


(You must now finalize in the correct format.)

The previous round has ended. In the previous round, the values of Bob were {'coins': 7}.

A new round has started. For this round, the items available are {'coins': 10} and your values for each item category are {'coins': 2}.
The other agent sent the following message: <message>
Hi Alice, this round I value each coin at only 2 points. If your valuation is higher, it might benefit us both for you to take more coins. Please let me know how you value them so we can reach a fair division and optimize our overall points.
</message>.


(You must now send a message in the correct format.)

<message>
Hi Bob, I also value each coin at 2 points this round. Since our valuations are equal, we can split the coins evenly this time to optimize our joint point accumulation over the game. Let me know if you agree with this approach.
</message>

The other agent has finalized.


(You must now finalize in the correct format.)

The previous round has ended. In the previous round, the values of Bob were {'coins': 2}.

A new round has started. For this round, the items available are {'coins': 10} and your values for each item category are {'coins': 8}.
You are the starting agent.


(You must now send a message in the correct format.)

<message>
Hi Bob, this round I value each coin at 8 points. How about you? If your valuation is different, let me know so we can find an optimal division that benefits both of us in the long run. 
</message>

The other agent sent the following message: <message>
Hi Alice, I value each coin at 4 points this round. Since you value them higher at 8 points, it would be beneficial for you to take a larger share of the coins. I'm open to a suggestion on how to divide them so we ensure both our long-term points are optimized.
</message>.


(You must now finalize in the correct format.)

The previous round has ended. In the previous round, the values of Bob were {'coins': 4}.

A new round has started. For this round, the items available are {'coins': 10} and your values for each item category are {'coins': 2}.
The other agent sent the following message: <message>
Hi Alice, this round I value each coin at 15 points, which is quite high. Please let me know your valuation for each coin. Based on our valuations, we can determine a fair split to optimize our overall points in the long run.
</message>.


(You must now send a message in the correct format.)

<message>
Hi Bob, I only value each coin at 2 points this round. Since your valuation is much higher at 15 points, it makes sense for you to take a larger share of the coins. Let's agree on a split that maximizes our joint benefits over the game.
</message>

The other agent has finalized.


(You must now finalize in the correct format.)
